content: this pattern is for your personal use and the contents are my original work do not share any portions of this pattern in any form for others to use you are 100% free to sell any physical items made with this pattern please tag me @womanwalkingawire in any social media posts of items made with this pattern or link the pattern all my social and shop links can be found here linktr ee/womanwalkingawire message me with any questions at any time of day i usually respond within 24 hours if you are having trouble and want to reach out to me for help send pics enjoy i look forward to seeing what you ve created with this pattern abbreviations-us terms materials sm- stitch marker 4mm crochet hook slip_stitch- slip_stitch 1 stitch marker chain- chain worsted weight size 4 yarn chsp- chain space yarn needle single_crochet- single_crochet sewing needle double_crochet- double_crochet sewing thread just a foot fo- fasten_off 1 button scissors ©2024 christine anne melvin/womanwalkingawire 1 this pattern is meant to be used with the following patterns ending in 96 sts granny s eye granny square alternate version only grandpa s granny free alien head granny granny burger the night owl granny strawberry pop-ups granny s heart granny the great granny pumpkin sapphic granny santa hat s citrus granny classic candy corn playing in the poppies free magic toadstool granny free the nipple unstuffed version only this pattern can be used with several of the other patterns however they might not be the best fit for the nature of the pocket bag for instance the maryjane is the right size but unless the leaf has been secured down either by being sewn or glued to the back circle there will be too much wear and tear on those components as the bag is being pulled in and out of the pocket same is true of any of the patterns that have a chain symbol in the center youtube video for full pattern on my channel youtube com/@womanwalkingawire https //youtu be/mc0g14ixw5w si=d26ajxq5iict753a ©2024 christine anne melvin/womanwalkingawire 2 round 1 take your 2 squares and place them right side facing each other making sure that if the square has a top and bottom that the top is directed upwards both squares should have 3 single_crochet in the corner chsps position your hook through both squares in the st just before the 3 corner sts working sts through both squares single_crochet into 1st st 2 single_crochet into next 3 sts single_crochet next 21 sts x3 2 single_crochet into next 3 sts single_crochet into next st working only through 1 of the squares the one furthest from you single_crochet next 19 sts slip_stitch to 1st st to join do not fo 108 sts ©2024 christine anne melvin/womanwalkingawire 3 round 2 chain 6 counts as 1st double_crochet and chain 3 skip 2 sts double_crochet into next chain 3 x 34 skip 2 sts double_crochet into next double_crochet into 3rd chain of beginning chain 6 do not
